TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

> There are only 297 members with 5 dots on the forums, but over 126 thousand members with only one dot. Also, you only have to go ~2600 pages in to a ~8000 page member list sorted by post count to reach the last person with just one post. I'm considering learning to use python to scrape post count and reputation to take a look at more of this stuff, but it'd take a while with the 1 search per 2 second limit.
> 

So if I get 1,499 reputation then I get to five dots?

> 
> 
> 16 minutes ago, HansonKerman said:
> 
> 
> [@JustJim](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/111360-justjim/) and [@Just Jim](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/148725-just-jim/) are different users.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> How do you link a pic to a link?﻿
> 

Either paste the image in your post, then CTRL-RMB click it and use the options to add a link, or use the "Link" editor button (looks like a chain) and put something like this into it:

    URL:		https://exapmle.target.link.ksp/content
    Link text:	[IMG=https://i.imgur.com/zPGxL5V.png]

The result won't embed in your post until you submit it:

[![zPGxL5V.png](https://i.imgur.com/zPGxL5V.png)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/)

EDIT: To clarify what's going on here, there are the remains of a BBcode parser in this forum software, and ![<url>]() is the BBcode tag to embed images.

> 
> 
> 13 minutes ago, The\_Cat\_In\_Space said:
> 
> 
> So if I get 1,499 reputation then I get to five dots?
> 

That's actually post count, not reputation. I'll clarify that.

If you have more than 1,499 posts (counting the same as the number underneath your avatar and reputation counter, above your location, i.e. all posts except those made in the Lounge), you will have 5 dots.

1400 = 4 dots

1499 = 4 dots

1500 = 5 dots

It might have been clearer to say that you need 1500 posts to have 5 dots, but using greater than symbols is too deeply ingrained in me from computer programming and off-by-one errors.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-08-05T22:57:39Z" title="08/05/2018 10:57  PM" data-short="5 yr">August 5, 2018</time> by Mad Rocket Scientist**
Wait -- what's <font face="Lucida Sans Unicode, Lucida Grande, sans-serif">the list of post count-userdot ratio?</font>

> 
> 
> 22 minutes ago, HansonKerman said:
> 
> 
> Wait -- what's <font face="Lucida Sans Unicode, Lucida Grande, sans-serif">the list of post count-userdot ratio?</font>
> 

1500 or more posts = 5 dots.

500 to 1499 = 4 dots

100 to 499 = 3 dots

5 to 99= 2 dots

0 to 4 = 1 dot

How do you put a user quote in a signature? And how do you put a quote from a different thread into a different thread?

> 
> 
> 28 minutes ago, HansonKerman said:
> 
> 
> How do you put a user quote in a signature? And how do you put a quote from a different thread into a different thread?
> 

Not sure about signatures, but to quote in a different thread, just press the + to the left of the quote button, then go to the thread you want to quote in, and press the "Quote 1 post" popup in the lower right. Note that it works across tabs.

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, CatastrophicFailure said:
> 
> 
> Veeeeery interestink...
> 

It *does* work! ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/ZNGIcon2.png ":o") Even on mobile!

Tho it does seem one needs to click the + icon on the post they’re quoting *into* in order to get the pop up, then remove the unwanted quote.

Because they already take up a lot of space on the pages. 

[@cubinator](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/150330-cubinator/) [@Deddly](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/62955-deddly/) and [@ManeTI](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/167672-maneti/) , as for the <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> thread acting up, that's because someone, who is <u>totally</u> not me, screwed up a couple of days ago. This person, who is still not me at all, thought he had fixed it and is embarrassed to learn that he hadn't. He's sorry.
Can there be *atleast* a scrollbar for them? so 80% of my links dont get vanished under the page?
